def_en: You use now to refer to the present time, often in contrast to a time in the past or the future.
If you do something now, you do it immediately.
You use now or now that to indicate that an event has occurred and as a result something else may or will happen.
You use now to indicate that a particular situation is the result of something that has recently happened.

def_cn: (用于讲述故事或过去的事情)这时，这会儿
def_en: In stories and accounts of past events, now is used to refer to the particular time that is being written or spoken about.
You use now in statements which specify the length of time up to the present that something has lasted.

def_cn: (引起听者的注意或改变话题)喂，喏，好
def_en: You say 'Now' or 'Now then' to indicate to the person or people you are with that you want their attention, or that you are about to change the subject.

def_cn: (用于考虑接下来想说的内容)哦，嗯
def_en: Some people say 'Now' when they are thinking of what to say next.

def_cn: (用于委婉地强调请求或命令)好，行
def_en: You use now to give a slight emphasis to a request or command.

def_cn: (引出与已讲述内容有关的信息及继续讲述之前需要了解的信息)你看，喏
def_en: You can say 'Now' to introduce information which is relevant to the part of a story or account that you have reached, and which needs to be known before you can continue.
You say 'Now' to introduce something which contrasts with what you have just said.
If you say that something happens now and then or every now and again, you mean that it happens sometimes but not very often or regularly.
If you say that something will happen any day now ,any moment now, or any time now, you mean that it will happen very soon.

def_cn: (用于转换话题或播报新活动)下面
def_en: People such as television presenters sometimes use now for when they are going to start talking about a different subject or presenting a new activity.
Just now means a very short time ago.
You use just now when you want to say that a particular situation exists at the time when you are speaking, although it may change in the future.

def_cn: 机不可失;勿失良机;错过这村没这店
def_en: If you say 'It's now or never', you mean that something must be done immediately, because if it is not done immediately there will not be another chance to do it.

def_cn: (用于劝慰他人)好啦，好啦;得啦，得啦
def_en: You can say 'now, now' as a friendly way of trying to comfort someone who is upset or distressed.

def_cn: (用于友好地告诫别人)算了，算了;好了，好了
def_en: You can say 'Now, then' or 'Now, now' when you want to give someone you know well a friendly warning not to behave in a particular way.
